Senior Artist Showcase - Ryann Grube

The timing is perfect to showcase this senior, she's a real firecracker! If you want to catch up to Ryann Grube, you will have to wear your running shoes! Ryann has been involved in so many great activities, like varsity softball, competitive cheer, student government, homecoming court, leadership conferences, and she is one of our valedictorians for the class of 2020. Even with all these events she has found time to volunteer in the art room decorating hats for members of the military, painting the girls bathroom with positive messages (her idea), and working at St. Anne's Church food closet. Ryann's art work this year was focused on a ceramic portfolio with a theme of water. Her pieces reflect the beauty and colors of our rivers, lakes, and oceans. Her hope is to inspire the viewer to appreciate and want to preserve the waters of our earth. She also, has a lot of fun with clay as you can see in her photos.
Ryann, go out and change the world and always take art with you!

post_text: REMINDER FOR SENIOR PARENTS! Graduation is going to be here before you know it! Senior Class Advisors, Mrs. Grube and Ms. Philippon, are hosting an important meeting for all senior parents tonight, March 2nd at 7:00 p.m. in the high school cafeteria. Senior students are also welcome to come! post_text: Jefferson High School graduates got together to decorate bowls for the Empty Bowls Event. Our own autos instructor, Jake Hefron (2017), got in touch with his artistic side! Sisters Sammi (2019)and Bekah (2018)Ballmes enjoyed glazing. The class of 2019 was well represented by Carrie Blagec, Raymond Owens, Ashley Waldecker, Julia Hatfield, Kristin Davis, Kailey Head, Janice Lin, and Lindsey Hammer. 2018 grads Dillon Tocco, Cole Mullins, Derek Barron, Dawson Wolgamuth, Mitchell Payment, Jordan Jones, Ashley Gleaser, and Karisa Carpenter turned out to help. Rachel Poore (1999) had help from 2020 graduate, her own daughter, Haley Best. Another mother and daughter team worked together, Katelyn (2019) and Jennifer (1999) Nadeau. Fueled by doughnuts and hot chocolate, many beautiful bowls were produced and a good time was had by all! Thank you Jefferson graduates, see you on March 12th!

post_text: The North and Sodt students came together for a very special assembly with the University of Toledo Opera on Wheels. Mrs. Orzechowski, our elementary music instructor, organized this special assembly for both schools. The Opera Company presented "Hansel and Gretel" for first through fourth grade students in the North cafeteria/gymnasium. It was a huge success and the students really enjoyed a very special show. A very special thank you to all of our parents for supporting our fundraising efforts. This helps bring special events to our Jefferson students.
